title: Loved the Hotel as much as NYC itself
text:
WOW!! that's the feeling when you walk in to this hotel.It has the most beautiful entrance and lobby.It sends you back in time and you can feel the presence of people past (no I'm not a psychic), it just feels so splendid and easy to imagine the era and people who stayed there.They play old songs like Frank Sinatra which just adds to the nostalgia.Bellhops and doormen in formal attire as well.
It first opened in 1924 and has been beautifully restored since then.
We booked in to our Cosy room,it was on the 18th floor.The room was clean and fresh.A shower room toilet with hand basin and complimentary toiletries.Plenty of towels.
32" TV with plenty of free channels plus some pay per view.The bed was so comfy and I'd have loved to take the pillows home!
There is no coffee maker.You can request one from reception,but being English we had brought tea coffee and our travel kettle!Room service was available but we didn't use it.
The view from the room was exactly what I'd expect in New York,we looked over at a massive building that at night lit up with the American Flag colours. The hotel is kept really well heated.Even though February we had to put the air conditioner on.
You have 6 lifts at the hotel and each time we used them they were pretty speedy but when the weekend arrived we did have to wait a long time and even took the stairs on one occasion all the way down from the 18th but we waited to get the lift back up!
You can eat and drink at the Roosevelt but we found some great cafes across the road on 5th Avenue that were cheap,cheerful and the food tasted great so we ate in different 5th Avenue cafes all week.
The Roosevelt is a stones throw from Times Square and Grand Central Station.Central to everything really.You won't get a better placed hotel.
Only one negative comment and that is the desk staff,some were really helpful but some were downright rude.
If you need help,directions etc,ask the doorman who were all really friendly and approachable.
We would definitely stay here again..loved it!
